results.title: Bovine contagious pleuropneumonia
results.brief_description: This film traces the introduction and spread of the disease throughout Australia; why it persists in the north and how in spite of all precautions it occasionally infiltrates to the south. The main section of the film depicts in detail the characteristic symptoms and post-mortem findings, the effectiveness of vaccination, and the nature of present and past research work of the Division of Animal Health and Production.

results.title: Famous boundary of creation
results.brief_description: Documents the French-American study of the mid-Atlantic ridge. Illustrates plate tectonics. Underwater photography is used in this geological study. Photography includes, Iceland, Hawaii and Azores.

results.title: Boston Symphony Orchestra
results.brief_description: The Boston Symphony Orchestra in Japan in 1960, conducted by Charles Munch and Aaron Copland, includes performances of sections of major works with narration kept to a minimum. Includes complete movements or sections from the following: Easley Blackwood Jnr - “Symphony No. 1”; Hector Berlioz - “Symphony Fantastique”; Aaron Copland - “The Tender Land”; Claude Debussy - Symphonic Poem “La Mer”.

results.title: Bossa pop
results.creator_credit: Sheldon Cohen, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Three animated figures, a man, a woman and a child, dance, arms and legs flying, to the compulsive rhythms of this Bossa Pop. A light film in carnival mood - who can remain still when the music commands? A film without words.

results.title: Born to boats
results.brief_description: Depicts the British as a people born to boats. Shows designing, process of vuilding, and use of yachts, lifeboats, racing shells, and other small craft. Scenes include yacht-racing at Cowes, Uffa Fox designing new speed-boats including Donald Campbell in his turbo jet boat “Bluebird” with his record breaking run at 204 mph, and rowing on the Thames.

results.title: Born spastic
results.creator_credit: National Coal Board and Spastic Society
results.brief_description: Unambiguously, the film explains cerebral palsy and shows various activities of handicapped people in England, including sheltered workshops and social clubs, like Joe’s Club, which caters not only for the handicapped, but their siblings as well. Both the handicapped and the people involved with them discuss some of the problems faced by the handicapped in England.

results.title: Born in the sun
results.creator_credit: John Heyer and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Shows the development of the dried fruits industry at Mildura from the time of Deakin’s irrigation bill, and highlights the part irrigation has played. Includes a dramatised extract of an Alfred Deakin speech. The film shows climatic setbacks which the industry has experienced. Illustrates the harvesting, processing and distribution of the fruit.

results.title: Born different
results.brief_description: A documentary about the mentally handicapped children cared for at the Melbourne Kew Cottages. Founded in 1887 mainly owing to the campaigning of Dr J.V. McCleery, the Superintendant of the Kew Mental Hospital, the cottages are now one of the largest government institutions for the care and training of mentally handicapped children. Gives an unusual insight into this little-understood problem in talks with nurses who tell of the activities at the centre. Parents of handicapped children explain what these children have meant in their lives, and of the decision to send the youngsters to the cottages. Narrated by Gerald Lyons.

results.title: Born Chinese
results.brief_description: One quarter of the world’s population is Chinese, yet their habits and customs are little known. This is a story of a Chinese family and the life that surrounds them. They left China soon after the Revolution and now live in one of the huge government housing blocks in the thriving British colony of Hong Kong, where since the mass exodus from China it is possible to mingle with greater freedom than ever before with people born and brought up in China. Tells of their domestic, social, business, and cultural life. Narrated by Anthony Lawrence.

results.title: Boring for water in South Africa
results.brief_description: An instructional film showing procedures in drilling water bores in arid areas of South Africa, from the geological survey to the setting up and operation of the drill rig. Includes drill-bit sharpening, operation and erection of a windmill to pump out water.
